listCustomShields.name: Brachyuran Cockle Shield
listCustomShields.description: Made from the shells of purpose bred giant clams, the grooves along a cockle shield are perfect for catching and deflecting away sword strikes.
listCustomShields.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomWeapons.name: Brachyuran Conch Spear
listCustomWeapons.description: Brachyuran conch spears are made using the shells from sea snails specifically bread to produce hard, elongated shells with pointed tips. These spears are designed to be usable both on land and in water, and as such bludgeoning attacks with conch spears do not incur the -2 circumstance penalty while underwater. A brachyuran conch spear is an uncommon advanced melee weapon in the spear group that deals 1d8 piercing damage and has the agile, brachyuran, reach, two-hand d10, and versatile bludgeoning traits.
listCustomWeapons.weaponTraits: Uncommon, Agile, Brachyuran, Reach, Two-Hand d10, Versatile B, 3rd Party

listCustomWeapons.name: Brachyuran Shell Spliter
listCustomWeapons.description: These short, thin knifes were originally designed for prying open clams and oysters and cutting out the meat within, but they're equally effective at piercing through the joints of armor- be it manufactured or natural. A brachyuran shell piercer is an uncommon martial melee weapon in the knife group that deals 1d4 piercing damage and has the agile, brachyuran, fatal d8, and versatile slashing traits.
listCustomWeapons.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk
listCustomWeapons.weaponTraits: Uncommon, Agile, Brachyuran, Fatal D8, Versatile S, 3rd Party

listCustomWeapons.name: Vice Claw (Crusher Arm)
listCustomWeapons.description: Your claws are especially adapted for crushing through enemy defenses. Your claws attacks gain the versatile P trait. You gain the critical specialization effect of your claw unarmed attack.
listCustomWeapons.src: Graung’s Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk
listCustomWeapons.weaponTraits: 3rd Party, Brachyuran, Crusher Arm, Versatile P

listCustomFeats.name: Admonishing Snap
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisite Blitz Snipper
Trigger You are hit by a successful melee strike

You lull an enemy into a false sense of security when attacked. When you are hit and take damage from a melee attack, you can use your reaction to make a melee Strike with your claw unarmed attack against the attacker. This Strike doesn't count toward your multiple attack penalty, and your multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Anchored Climber
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisite you have a climb speed

You can use your legs to hang from any suitable anchor point, such as a tree branch, balcony, or rocky outcropping (subject to the GM's discretion), typically while climbing. While hanging, you have free use of all your other limbs, so you can perform tasks that require both hands, such as firing a bow or swinging a greatsword.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Autonomic Limb
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per hour
Trigger You would be reduced to 0 Hit Points but not immediately killed by a melee strike from an adjacent creature.
Requirements You have at least one arm or at least three legs.

Your people long ago learned that a lost claw is better than a lost life. You allow your claw or leg to be caught in the attack, separating it from your body to avoid further damage and create an opening to escape. If the limb is an arm, any items held by that arm are dropped. You avoid being knocked out, the damage from the strike becomes half of your hit points rounded down (minimum 1), and your Wounded condition increases by 1.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Barnacle Encrusted
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You've formed a symbiotic relationship with a colony of barnacles, offering them a place to live on your shell in exchange for providing you with a degree of protection. During your daily preparations, you gain resistance 5 to physical damage (except adamantine). Any time this resistance prevents damage, it decreases by 1, to a minimum of 0 as the barnacles die off. However, when your resistance is below 5, it slowly recovers itself over time; for every 10 minutes, it increases by 1, to a maximum of 5 as new barnacles grow.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Blitz Snipper
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
The muscles in your claws allow them to snap shut with lightening speed, increasing their combat effectiveness. Choose one of the following benefits.

• Your vice claws gain the agile trait.
• Your vice claw damage die increases from 1d6 to 1d8.

Special You can select this feat a second time to gain both benefits.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Bonded Companion
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Many brachyuran form symbiotic relationships with animals, and the bond you share with your companion is especially strong. You gain a familiar. The type of animal is up to you, but most brachyuran choose animals with a swim Speed.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Brachyuran Lore
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You know well about the arts of the Brachyuran people. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Crafting and Performance. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

You also gain the Additional Lore general feat for Brachyuran Lore.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Brachyuran Magicraft
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisite expert in Crafting

You channel innate primal magic into your craftwork. You gain the Magical Crafting skill feat. When you gain Magical Crafting in this way, the formulas granted by that feat may also include uncommon brachyuran magic items of 5th level or lower.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Brachyuran Weapon Familiarity
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Your people have a diverse range of preferred weapons, and you reflect this fact. You gain access to all uncommon weapons with the brachyuran trait. You have familiarity with weapons with the brachyuran trait plus flyssas, repeating hand crossbows, and tridents—for the purposes of proficiency, you treat any of these that are martial weapons as simple weapons and any that are advanced weapons as martial weapons.

At 5th level, whenever you get a critical hit with one of these weapons, you get its critical specialization effect.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Caustic Foam
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per day

When threatened you regurgitate some of your stomach acid and froth it with your mouth into a clinging foam. For 1 minute, any creature that touches you or damages you with an unarmed attack or melee weapon without the reach trait takes 3d6 acid damage.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Chitinous Scalpel
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisite trained in Medicine

Your claws are exceptionally sharp, and you've learned they can be used to treat allies' injuries. You gain the Risky Surgery skill feat. In addition, your claws unarmed attack gains the versatile S trait.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Communicative Dance
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Brachyurans often find it easier to convey information by weaving dance and gesticulation into their speech. You're trained in Performance. If you would automatically become trained in Performance (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You gain Impressive Performance as a bonus feat.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Crafty Crab
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You apprenticed under one of your village's master artisans. You're trained in Crafting. If you would automatically become trained in Crafting (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You gain Specialty Crafting as a bonus feat.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Crushing Vice
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisite Gripping Claw

Your grip is so strong that you can crush bones with ease. Whenever you succeed an Athletics check to Grapple a creature using your claws, that creature must attempt a Fortitude save against the higher of your class DC or spell DC, becoming Enfeebled 1 on a failure, or Enfeebled 2 on a critical failure, until their Hit Points are restored to their maximum.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Crustacean Communication
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Your connection to sea life allows you to communicate with animals on a fundamental level. You can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals. In most cases, wild animals will give you time to make your case. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Make an Impression on animals.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Deep Sea Sight
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You've spent a lot of time on the deep seafloor where little sunlight can reach. You gain Darkvision.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Distracting Dance
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
The way you move and sway in communication can be disorienting and distracting to your foes. Attempt a Performance check against the Will DC of a single enemy within 30 feet. This has all the usual traits and restrictions of a Performance check to dance.

You can affect up to two targets within range if you have expert proficiency in Performance, four if you have master proficiency, and eight if you have legendary proficiency.

Critical Success The target takes a –1 status penalty to Perception checks and Will saves for 1 minute.
Success The target takes a –1 status penalty to Perception checks and Will saves for 1 round.
Critical Failure The target is unaffected and temporarily immune to Distracting Dance for 1 hour.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Escape Scuttle
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per day
Trigger An adjacent creature you can see critically misses an attack roll against you.

You take advantage of the opening left by your enemy to quickly scuttle away. You Step.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Eyestalk Vision
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Your eyes extend away from your body allowing you to quickly see in all directions at once, making it harder for predators to ambush you. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks attempted as initiative rolls. Additionally, if your initiative roll result is tied with that of an opponent, you go first, regardless of whether you rolled Perception or not.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Fleeing Scuttle
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisite Escape Scuttle

You can flee faster and further when taking advantage of a foe's opening. When you use Escape Scuttle, you can Stride up to half your speed instead of Stepping.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Funerary Dance
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisite expert in Performance
Frequency once per day

You perform a funerary dance that invokes The Sunken One, calling upon her to claim the bodies of your foes. Your foes are assaulted with visions of a swarm of small crustaceans bursting forth from the bloated carcass of a whale to tear at their bodies and consume their flesh. All enemies that can see you within a 30-foot emanation take 6d8 mental damage, with a basic Will saving throw against the higher of your class DC or spell DC. At 18th level, the damage increases to 7d8, and at 20th level, the damage increases to 8d8.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.
Success The creature takes half damage and is Frightened 1.
Failure The creature takes full damage and is Frightened 2.
Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is Frightened 3.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Gripping Claw
listCustomFeats.textDescription: The muscles in your claws are especially strong. Your claws gain the Grapple trait. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks made to Grapple with your claws.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Impervious Gastronomy
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisite iron belly brachyuran heritage

Your immune system is even more robust than your kin's. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to saving throws against things you ingest, such as ingested poisons and diseases. If you roll a success on such a saving throw, you get a critical success instead.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Intimidating Dance
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisite trained in Performance

You frighten enemies by dancing menacingly while snapping your claws. You can Demoralize using Performance rather than Intimidation. If you use Performance to Demoralize, it loses the auditory trait and gains the manipulate and visual traits, and you don't take a penalty if the creature doesn't understand your language. You cannot Demoralize in this way if you cannot use your claws or do not have a free hand.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Lightning Scuttle
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisite Scuttling Dash

Your ancestors survived by out speeding enemies and danger alike. When you use Scuttling Dash you can Step and/or Stride up to three times.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Master of the Arts
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisite master in Crafting, Crafty Crab

You are recognized as one of the great master crafters of your people. You gain Impeccable Crafting as a Bonus feat. In addition, when you use Crafting to Earn Income in a Brachyuran settlement or a settlement with a sizable Brachyuran presence (as decided by the GM), if you roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Mesmerizing Dance
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisite master in Performance
Target one creature you can see

The swaying movements of your communicative dance are mesmerizing to enemies. The target makes a Will save against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher, with the following results.

Regardless of the result, the target is temporarily immune to Mesmerizing Dance for 24 hours. Additionally, you may use your dance to communicate a single sentence message which can be understood by any creature who can see you and speaks Brachyuran.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.
Success The target is Fascinated by you for 1 round.
Failure The target is Stupefied 1 for 1 round.
Critical Failure The target is Stupefied 2 for 1 round and then Stupefied 1 for 1 round.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Molt
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per day

You shed your damaged exoskeleton, allowing you to more easily heal your wounds. Attempt a Medicine check with the same DC and taking the same amount of time as Treat Wounds. This doesn't remove the Wounded condition. Additionally, after you molt, any missing limbs will begin to slowly regrow, taking 3-5 days to regrow a claw or foot, and 2-4 weeks to grow an arm or leg.

While a limb is regrowing, it cannot be used to its full ability, and you are Enfeebled 1 for any checks that would require the use of that limb (at the GM's discretion).

Special If you are untrained in Medicine, the check has DC 10 to restore 1d8 Hit Points, or2d8 on a Critical Success.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Molting Regeneration
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisite Molt
Frequency once per day

Your molting taps into primal energies, granting you regeneration. When you Molt, you gain regeneration 15 for 1 minute, which restores 15 Hit Points to you at the start of each of your turns. While you have regeneration, you can't die from damage, and your Dying condition can't increase to a value that would kill you (this stops most creatures from going beyond dying 3), though if your Wounded value becomes 4 or higher, you stay unconscious until your wounds are treated. If you take fire damage, your regeneration deactivates until after the end of your next turn.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Packshell
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisite hermit brachyuran heritage
Frequency once per day

You are able to store items within your shell. Your shell functions as a Backpack. Once per day, you can interact as a free action to withdraw an item of 1 bulk or less from your shell.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Quick Molt
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisite Molt

You are able to quickly Molt in combat and have learned that doing so can be unsettling for others. When you quick molt, all creatures who can see or hear you within a 15-foot emanation must attempt a basic Fortitude save against either your class DC or spell DC (whichever is higher), becoming Sickened 1 on a Failure or Sickened 2 on a Critical Failure. Additionally, you immediately end all Persistent Damage from effects that coat your skin (such as persistent fire and most persistent acid damage). If you're suffering from an effect other than persistent damage that depends on continuous contact with your skin, and if that effect allows a saving throw, immediately attempt a new saving throw against that effect.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Rending Claw
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisite crusher arm brachyuran heritage or Blitz Snipper

Your claws have numerous small spikes and spines which can tear into an enemy's flesh. Your claw unarmed attack deals 1d4 persistent bleed damage on a critical hit. This damage increases to 2d4 at level 14 and 3d4 at level 19.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Scuttling Dash
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You can balance on your leg tips to step carefully over obstructions. You Stride and then Step, or Step and then Stride, ignoring difficult terrain during this movement.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Seabed Camouflage
listCustomFeats.textDescription: The shape and pattern of your shell make you difficult to see in water. While fully submerged in water, as long as an observer is at least 20 feet away from you, you don't need cover from that observer to Hide or Sneak.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Seabed Scavenger
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Rather than hunting prey, you subsist on scavenged carcasses. You become trained in Survival (or another skill of your choice if you're already trained in this skill). You gain a +1 Circumstance bonus to checks made to Subsist in or near large bodies of water.

Special If you have the Iron Belly Brachyuran heritage, increase the bonus to +2.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Snip Grip
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisite Gripping Claw
Trigger A creature at least one size larger than you within your reach leaves a square during a move action it's using and you have a free hand.

Your claws have vice-like strength, allowing you to hold onto enemies even when they try to flee. The target makes a Reflex save against your Athletics DC with the following results.

Critical Success The target evades you completely, causing you to lose your footing. As part of their movement, the target can choose to Reposition, Shove, or Trip you as if they had Succeeded a check to do so. This does not contribute to their multiple attack penalty.
Success You grab hold of the target and can choose to move up to 10 feet with it before losing your grip. The target is released if you choose not to move with it, if it moves more than 10 feet, at the start of your next turn, or if the target Escapes. Attempts to Escape from a Snip Grip are made against your Athletics DC, but they end the Snip Grip instead of the conditions normally ended by the Escape action.
Failure As success, but you can choose to move with the target for its full movement.
Critical Failure As failure, and your grip is tight enough to crush bone, dealing 1d6 bludgeoning damage to the target.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Snow Crab
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
It is said that your people were born from the ice itself. Your resistance to cold increases to 5 + half your level, and you can cast mantle of the frozen heart as an innate primal spell once per day.

Special If you are an arctic sea brachyuran, whenever you critically fail a save against a cold effect, you get a failure instead.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Steadfast Stance
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Your extra legs allow you to stand your ground with ease. You gain the Steady Balance skill feat, even if you aren't trained in Acrobatics. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Fortitude saves against attempts to Shove you. This bonus also applies to saving throws against spells or effects that attempt to move you or knock you prone. At the GM's discretion, this ability might not work on ground that does not offer secure purchase.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Steady Legs
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Your numerous legs make it much harder to knock you down. You gain a +2 status bonus to Reflex DC against attempts to Trip you.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Stories from Those Passed
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You've attended enough Brachyuran Funerary Feasts that you've gleaned a wide pool of knowledge. Choose two common Lore subcategories. You become trained in both. If you fail a check to Recall Knowledge using either of these Lore skills, you get the effects of the Dubious Knowledge skill feat. You may take this feat multiple times, choosing new Lore subcategories each time.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, choosing new Lore subcategories each time.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Surge and Flow
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Your connection to the primal magic of the seas causes water to occasionally move in response to your emotions. You can cast dancing fountain as a 7th-rank primal innate spell once per day.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Surging Excavation
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You have an innate connection to primal magic. You can cast expeditious excavation and sea surge as 2nd-rank primal innate spells once per day each.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Swift Swimmer
listCustomFeats.textDescription: You are able to swim faster than most Brachyuran. Your swim Speed increases increases from 10 feet to 20 feet.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Tactical Molt
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisite Quick Molt

When you Quick Molt, if you are Grabbed or Restrained, you may make an Escape check as a free action, attempting to break free as you leave your old exoskeleton behind. A creature that had Grabbed or Restrained you continues to Grapple your exoskeleton as if it were a creature. After molting, you Step.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Tree Crab
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Your legs have pointed tips that enable you to climb trees and other sheer surfaces. You gain a climb Speed of 10 feet.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Unburdened Scuttle
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Prerequisite Scuttling Dash

Your legs deftly carry you to safety even on uneven ground. When you use Scuttling Dash, you ignore difficult terrain, and greater difficult terrain becomes difficult terrain instead during that movement. Additionally, you may Stride twice instead of making one Step and one Stride for Scuttling Dash.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Unreadable Expression
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Having an exoskeleton is advantageous when you need to lie— other ancestries have a difficult time reading your facial expressions and body language. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Deception checks made against humanoids.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: What Crab Bucket Mentality?
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Frequency once per day
An adjacent ally would be reduced to 0 HP but not immediately killed.

They say that crabs in a bucket will pull each other down, but brachyurans pull each other out of danger instead. You steady your ally on their feet. Your ally isn't knocked out and remains at 1 Hit Point. Your ally's Wounded condition still increases by 1 as though they had been dying and recovered.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFeats.name: Work Together!
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Your upbringing emphasized teamwork and helping your allies comes naturally to you. After you Aid an ally at a skill check that doesn't have the attack trait, you can also Aid any other ally who attempts the same skill check for the same purpose that round. You do so as a free action rather than a reaction.

The preparation you did to help must still apply to the other allies, and you can Aid each ally only once. For example, if you helped lift up an ally to Aid them on an Athletics check to scale a wall, you could keep the same posture to give a boost to other allies attempting to scale the wall in the same round.
listCustomFeats.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomHeritages.name: Arctic Sea Brachyuran
listCustomHeritages.textDescription: Your people hail from the frigid seas of the poles. You gain cold resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1). You treat environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme.
listCustomHeritages.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomHeritages.name: Armored Shell Brachyuran
listCustomHeritages.textDescription: Your exoskeleton is especially durable. Your exoskeleton is medium armor in the skeletal armor group that grants a +3 item bonus to AC, and has a Dex cap of +3, a check penalty of –2, a Speed penalty of –5 feet, a Strength value of 14, and the comfort trait. You can never wear other armor or remove your exoskeleton. You can etch armor runes onto your exoskeleton.
listCustomHeritages.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomHeritages.name: Crusher Arm Brachyuran
listCustomHeritages.textDescription: Your claws are especially adapted for crushing through enemy defenses. Your claws attacks gain the versatile P trait. You gain the critical specialization effect of your claw unarmed attack.
listCustomHeritages.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomHeritages.name: Hermit Brachyuran
listCustomHeritages.textDescription: You carry a shell that you wear on your back. This shell weighs 2 bulk but does not count towards your encumbrance limit. While wearing your shell, you gain the Retract reaction.
listCustomHeritages.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomHeritages.name: Iron Belly Brachyuran
listCustomHeritages.textDescription:
You can subsist on food that most folks would consider spoiled. You can eat and drink things when you are sickened.
You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to saving throws against afflictions, against gaining the sickened condition, and to remove the sickened condition. When you roll a success on a Fortitude save affected by this bonus, you get a critical success instead. All these benefits apply only when the affliction or condition resulted from something you ingested.
listCustomHeritages.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomHeritages.name: Pistol Arm Brachyuran
listCustomHeritages.textDescription: Your people have learned how to manipulate air and water currents as a unique means of stunning prey. You gain slashing gust as a primal innate cantrip at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell rank equal to half your level rounded up. When cast in or near a body of water, you can give the spell the Water trait instead of Air.
listCustomHeritages.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomHeritages.name: Scuttler Brachyuran
listCustomHeritages.textDescription: Your legs are able to carry you swiftly away from predators. Your land speed increases by 5.
listCustomHeritages.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomSpecial.name: Armored Shell
listCustomSpecial.description: Your exoskeleton is especially durable. Your exoskeleton is medium armor in the skeletal armor group that grants a +3 item bonus to AC, and has a Dex cap of +3, a check penalty of –2, a Speed penalty of –5 feet, a Strength value of 14, and the comfort trait. You can never wear other armor or remove your exoskeleton. You can etch armor runes onto your exoskeleton.
listCustomSpecial.src: Graung’s Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomSpecial.name: Crusher Arm
listCustomSpecial.description: Your claws are especially adapted for crushing through enemy defenses. Your claws attacks gain the versatile P trait. You gain the critical specialization effect of your claw unarmed attack.
listCustomSpecial.src: Graung’s Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomSpecial.name: Darkvision
listCustomSpecial.description: You can see in darkness and dim light just as well as you can see in bright light, though your vision in darkness is in black and white.

listCustomSpecial.name: Retract
listCustomSpecial.description:
Frequency once per hour
Trigger An adjacent creature attempts to strike you and you can see the attacker.

You quickly withdraw into your shell, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

listCustomSpecial.name: Vice Claw
listCustomSpecial.description: Your claws are well adapted as both tools and weapons. You have a Claw unarmed attack that deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage. Your claw is in the brawling weapon group and has the finesse and unarmed traits.
listCustomSpecial.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomAncestries.name: Brachyuran
listCustomAncestries.description:
Hit Points 8
Size Small
Speed 25
Ability Boosts Dexterity, Wisdom, Free
Ability FlawsCharisma
Languages Common, Brachyuran
Brachyurans are large, intelligent crustaceans who tend towards living along coastlines and riverbanks but can be found throughout Golarion. Brachyurans are generally incredibly community oriented and can be gregarious to a fault. They prefer living in harmony with nature, acting as stewards of the natural world around them when possible, and eschewing anything they consider to be wasteful of nature's bounties. Brachyurans are especially talented crafters, with the most skilled said to rival even the greatest of dwarven masters, and many are quite skilled in performance owing to the rythmic swaying of their body language woven into their speech.
listCustomAncestries.src: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomFamiliars.name: Anemone
listCustomFamiliars.description: Brachyurans  who gain familiars tend to overwhelmingly favor those with some connection to the natural world. Anemones are especially favored as many brachyurans keep them as pets, similar to humans' affinity for cats.
listCustomFamiliars.source: Graung's Guide to Golarion: Brachyuran Crabfolk

listCustomSpecials.name: Anchored
listCustomSpecials.description: an anemone does not have and cannot gain a speed, nor can it select any familiar or master abilities that require a speed or for it to move. Instead the anemone is attached to its master, either directly to its skin, on its armor, or otherwise on a special ceramic plate designed to give the anemone a portable anchor point.

listCustomSpecials.name: Envenom Weapon
listCustomSpecials.description: The anemone excretes its toxin which can be used to coat a weapon held by an adjacent creature. For one minute, the coated weapon deals 1 additional poison damage per weapon damage die.

listCustomSpecials.name: Hydration
listCustomSpecials.description: brachyuran anemone are able to breathe air as well as water, but their bodies require them to return to aquatic environments at least once in a 24-hour period. They must submerge in water in order to rehydrate their water-acclimated skin. If they fail to do this, their skin begins to crack and become painful. After the first 24 hours outside of water, they take a –1 status penalty to Fortitude saves. After 48 hours, they struggle to breathe air and begin to suffocate until returned to water.
